text.0: may our divine and brilliant hymn go forth like a swift chariot wrought and fashioned well.
text.1: the waters listen as they flow along they know the origin of heaven and earth.
text.2: yea the broad waters swell their flood ior him of him strong heroes think amid their foes.
text.3: set ye for him the coursers to the pole like indra thunderer is the goldenarmed.
text.4: arouse you like the days to sacrifice speed gladly like a traveller on the way.
text.5: go swift to battles to the sacrifice set up a flag a hero for the folk.
text.6: up from his strength hath risen as twere a light it bears the load as earth bears living things.
text.7: agni no demon i invoke the gods by law completing it i form a hymn.
text.8: closely albout you lay your heavenly song and send your voice to where the gods abide.
text.9: varuṇa mighty with a thousand eyes beholds the paths wherein these rivers run.
text.10: he king of kings the glory of the floods oer all that liveth hath resistless sway.
text.11: may he assist us among all the tribes and make the enviers praise devoid of light.
text.12: may the foes threatening arrow pass us by may he put far from us our bodies sin.
text.13: agni oblationcater through our prayers aid us to him our dearest laud is brought.
text.14: accordant with the gods choose for our friend the waters child may he be good to us.
text.15: with lauds i sing the dragon born of floods he sits beneath the streams in middle air.
text.16: neer may the dragon of the deep harm us neer fail this faithful servants sacrifice.
text.17: to these our heroes may they grant renown may pious men march boldly on to wealth.
text.18: leading great hosts with fierce attacks of these they burn their foes as the sun burns the earth.
text.19: what time our wives draw near to us may he lefthanded tvaṣṭar give us hero sons.
text.20: may tvaṣṭar find our hymn acceptable and may aramati seeking wealth be ours.
text.21: may they who lavish gifts bestow those treasures may rodasī and varuṇānī listen.
text.22: may he with the varūtrīs be our refuge may bountiful tvaṣṭar give us store of riches.
text.23: so may rich mountains and the liberal waters so may all herbs that grow on ground and heaven.
text.24: and earth accordant with the forestsovrans and both the worldhalves round about protect us.
text.25: to this may both the wide worlds lend approval and varuṇa in heaven whose friend is indra.
text.26: may all the maruts give consent the victors that we may hold great wealth in firm possession.
text.27: may indra varuṇa mitra and agni waters herbs trees accept the praise we offer.
text.28: may we find refuge in the maruts bosom protect us evermore ye gods with blessings.
